intro: Acaciopsis, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow floral clusters. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Acaciopsis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and is also cultivated for ornamental purposes.
